title: Provides for the suspension of a driver's license upon a conviction of boating while intoxicated and vice versa
summary: Provides for the suspension of a driver's license upon a conviction of boating while intoxicated and for the suspension of the privilege to operate a vessel upon the waters of this state upon a conviction of driving while ability impaired or driving while intoxicated or under the influence of drugs.

BILL NUMBER:S2073

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the navigation law and the vehicle and traffic law, in relation
to the suspension of privileges to operate a vessel and driver's
licenses for certain alcohol related offenses

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
The suspension of a
driver's license
upon a conviction of boating while intoxicated and vice versa.
Section 1. Subdivisions 3 and 4 of section 49-a of the navigation
law, as added by chapter 805 of the laws of 1992, are amended.

JUSTIFICATION:
With this law enacted many lives can
be saved and
injuries avoided by making the law more strict as to alcohol
consumption allowed by law in the operation of a vessel.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect the first
of November next
succeeding the date on which it shall become law.
